Ingredients: Mutton (500g), Gongura Leaves (1 cup), Onion (1), Tomato (2), Garlic (4 cloves), Ginger (1-inch piece), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Coriander Powder (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Garam Masala (1 tsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions, garlic, and ginger. Sauté until golden brown.3. Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.4. Add mutton pieces and cook for 5 minutes.5. Add gongura leaves and enough water to cover the mutton. Pressure cook for 30 minutes.6. Add garam masala and simmer for 5 minutes.7. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Recipe Steps: 1. Grate ginger finely and mix with red chili powder and salt.2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and fenugreek seeds. Sauté until aromatic.3. Pour the tempering over the ginger mixture and mix well.4. Store in an airtight container and serve as a pickle.

Ingredients: Raw Mango (1), Split Green Gram (1/2 cup), Green Chilies (2), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)

Ingredients: Tamarind (1 small ball), Sesame Seeds (2 tbsp), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Jaggery (1 tbsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak tamarind in water and extract its juice.2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Sauté until aromatic.3. Add tamarind juice, sesame seeds, red chili powder, jaggery, and salt. Cook until thick.4. Serve as a chutney with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Split Pigeon Pea (1/2 cup), Tamarind (1 small ball), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)

Ingredients: Jaggery (1/2 cup), Coconut (1/2 cup, grated), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)

Recipe Steps: 1. Extract lemon juice and mix with red chili powder and salt.2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and fenugreek seeds. Sauté until aromatic.3. Pour the tempering over the lemon mixture and mix well.4. Store in an airtight container and serve as a pickle.

Ingredients: Palm Sap (1 liter), Natural Yeast (for fermentation)
Recipe Steps: 1. Collect fresh palm sap from toddy palms. 2. Allow the sap to ferment naturally using wild yeast present in the environment. 3. Ferment for 1-2 days in a clean container. 4. Once fermented, strain and serve chilled.

Ingredients: Palm Sap (1 liter), Natural Yeast (for fermentation)
Recipe Steps: 1. Collect fresh palm sap from coconut or other palm trees. 2. Allow the sap to ferment naturally using wild yeast present in the environment. 3. Ferment for 1-2 days in a clean container. 4. Once fermented, strain and serve chilled.

Ingredients: Fermented Grains (Rice, Millets), Water, Natural Yeast
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak grains like rice or millets in water overnight. 2. Drain and allow them to ferment with natural yeast for 3-5 days. 3. Distill the fermented mixture to extract alcohol. 4. Dilute with water as needed and serve.

Ingredients: Fermented Grains (Rice, Millets), Jaggery, Water, Natural Yeast
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak grains like rice or millets in water overnight. 2. Add jaggery to enhance fermentation. 3. Allow the mixture to ferment for 3-5 days. 4. Strain and serve cautiously (historical context only).

Ingredients: Palm Sap (1 liter), Natural Yeast (for fermentation)
Recipe Steps: 1. Collect fresh palm sap from date palms. 2. Allow the sap to ferment naturally using wild yeast present in the environment. 3. Ferment for 1-2 days in a clean container. 4. Once fermented, strain and serve chilled.

Ingredients: Fermented Rice (1 cup), Water, Natural Yeast
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak rice in water overnight. 2. Drain and allow it to ferment with natural yeast for 2-3 days. 3. Blend the fermented rice with water to form a liquid. 4. Strain and serve chilled.

Ingredients: Rice (1 cup), Water, Natural Yeast
Recipe Steps: 1. Cook rice and let it cool. 2. Mix cooked rice with water and allow it to ferment with natural yeast for 3-5 days. 3. Strain the liquid and serve chilled.

Ingredients: Nannari Root Powder (2 tbsp), Water (1 liter), Sugar (1/2 cup), Lemon Juice (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Boil water and add nannari root powder. Simmer for 10 minutes. 2. Strain the liquid and let it cool. 3. Add sugar and lemon juice. Mix well. 4. Serve chilled.

Ingredients: Jaggery (1/2 cup), Buttermilk (1 liter), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Dissolve jaggery in warm water and strain to remove impurities. 2. Mix the jaggery syrup with buttermilk. 3. Add cardamom powder and mix well. 4. Serve chilled.

Ingredients: Jaggery (1/2 cup), Lemon Juice (2 tbsp), Water (1 liter), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Dissolve jaggery in warm water and strain to remove impurities. 2. Add lemon juice and cardamom powder. Mix well. 3. Chill and serve.

Ingredients: Cumin Powder (1 tsp), Soda Water (1 glass), Lemon Juice (1 tbsp), Sugar (1 tsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix cumin powder, sugar, and lemon juice in a glass. 2. Add soda water and stir gently. 3. Serve immediately with ice.

Ingredients: Carbonated Water (1 bottle), Syrup (as per taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Pour carbonated water into a glass. 2. Add flavored syrup as per taste. 3. Stir gently and serve with ice.

Recipe Steps: 1. Peel and chop mangoes into small pieces. 2. Blend mango pieces with water until smooth. 3. Add sugar if needed and blend again. 4. Strain and serve chilled.

Ingredients: Basmati Rice (2 cups), Chicken (500g), Onion (2), Tomato (2), Garlic (4 cloves), Telangana Biryani Masala (2 tbsp), Yogurt (1/2 cup), Mint Leaves (10), Coriander Leaves (2 tbsp), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Marinate chicken with yogurt, Telangana biryani masala, garlic paste, mint leaves, coriander leaves, and salt.2. Cook basmati rice separately and set aside.3. Heat oil in a pan, add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.4. Add marinated chicken and cook until tender.5. Layer the cooked rice over the chicken in a heavy-bottomed pot.6. Seal the pot with dough or foil and cook on low heat (dum) for 20-30 minutes.7. Serve hot with raita or pickle.

Seal the pot with dough or foil and cook on low heat (dum) for 20-30 minutes.7. Serve hot with raita or pickle.

Seal the pot with dough or foil and cook on low heat (dum) for 20-30 minutes.9. Serve hot with raita or pickle.

Ingredients: Basmati Rice (2 cups), Boneless Chicken (500g), Onion (2), Tomato (2), Vijayawada Biryani Masala (2 tbsp), Yogurt (1/2 cup), Mint Leaves (10), Coriander Leaves (2 tbsp), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Marinate boneless chicken with yogurt, Vijayawada biryani masala, mint leaves, coriander leaves, and salt.2. Cook basmati rice separately and set aside.3. Heat oil in a pan, add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.4. Add marinated chicken and cook until tender.5. Layer the cooked rice over the chicken in a heavy-bottomed pot.6. Seal the pot with dough or foil and cook on low heat (dum) for 20-30 minutes.7. Serve hot with raita or pickle.

Recipe Steps: Recipe Steps

Ingredients: Rice (2 cups), Urad Dal (1/2 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak 2 cups of rice and 1/2 cup of urad dal in water for 6-8 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked rice and dal separately into a fine batter.3. Mix the two batters together in a large bowl, add salt to taste, and mix well.4. Cover the batter and let it ferment in a warm place for 8-12 hours or overnight.5. Once fermented, stir the batter gently to mix.6. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan.7. Spread the batter in a circular motion to form a thin crepe.8. Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges of the dosa.9. Cook until the dosa turns golden brown and crispy.10. Fold the dosa and serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Rice (2 cups), Urad Dal (1/2 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking), Potatoes (2), Onion (1), Green Chilies (2), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak 2 cups of rice and 1/2 cup of urad dal in water for 6-8 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked rice and dal separately into a fine batter.3. Mix the two batters together in a large bowl, add salt to taste, and mix well.4. Cover the batter and let it ferment in a warm place for 8-12 hours or overnight.5. For the masala filling, boil 2 potatoes until tender. Peel and mash them.6. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, chopped onions, and green chilies. Sauté until onions are translucent.7. Add turmeric powder, mashed potatoes, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes. Set aside.8. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan.9. Spread the batter in a circular motion to form a thin crepe.10. Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges of the dosa.11. Place a portion of the potato masala in the center of the dosa.12. Fold the dosa over the filling and cook for another minute.13. Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

Ingredients: Rice (2 cups), Urad Dal (1/2 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking), Onions (2), Green Chilies (2), Coriander Leaves (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak 2 cups of rice and 1/2 cup of urad dal in water for 6-8 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked rice and dal separately into a fine batter.3. Mix the two batters together in a large bowl, add salt to taste, and mix well.4. Cover the batter and let it ferment in a warm place for 8-12 hours or overnight.5. Finely chop 2 onions, 2 green chilies, and 2 tablespoons of coriander leaves.6. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan.7. Spread the batter in a circular motion to form a thin crepe.8. Sprinkle chopped onions, green chilies, and coriander leaves evenly over the dosa.9. Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges of the dosa.10. Cook until the dosa turns golden brown and crispy.11. Fold the dosa and serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Rice (2 cups), Urad Dal (1/2 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)

Cover the batter and let it ferment in a warm place for 8-12 hours or overnight.6. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.7. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it in a circular motion.8. Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges of the dosa.9. Cook until the dosa turns golden brown and crispy.10. Fold the dosa and serve hot with chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Rice (2 cups), Urad Dal (1/2 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking), Pizza Sauce (2 tbsp), Cheese (grated, 1/4 cup), Veggies (chopped, bell peppers, onions, etc.)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak 2 cups of rice and 1/2 cup of urad dal in water for 6-8 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked rice and dal separately into a fine batter.3. Mix the two batters together in a large bowl, add salt to taste, and mix well.4. Cover the batter and let it ferment in a warm place for 8-12 hours or overnight.5. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.6. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it in a circular motion.7. Spread pizza sauce evenly over the dosa.8. Sprinkle grated cheese and chopped veggies over the dosa.9. Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges of the dosa.10. Cook until the dosa turns golden brown and the cheese melts.11. Fold the dosa and serve hot as a fusion dish.

Ingredients: Rice (2 cups), Urad Dal (1/2 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking), Mixed Vegetables (chopped, carrots, beans, onions, etc.)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak 2 cups of rice and 1/2 cup of urad dal in water for 6-8 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked rice and dal separately into a fine batter.3. Mix the two batters together in a large bowl, add salt to taste, and mix well.4. Cover the batter and let it ferment in a warm place for 8-12 hours or overnight.5. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.6. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it into a thick circle.7. Place chopped mixed vegetables evenly over the dosa.8. Ingredients: Rice (2 cups), Grated Coconut (1/2 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak 2 cups of rice in water for 4-5 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked rice with grated coconut and water into a very thin, watery batter.3. Add salt to the batter and mix well.4. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over low heat.5. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it lightly without spreading too much.6. Cook on low heat without flipping. The dosa should be soft and slightly transparent.7. Remove and serve hot with coconut chutney or spicy curry.

Ingredients: Rice (2 cups), Urad Dal (1/2 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak 2 cups of rice and 1/2 cup of urad dal in water for 6-8 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked rice and dal separately into a fine batter.3. Mix the two batters together, add salt to taste, and mix well.4. Let the batter ferment in a warm place for 8-12 hours or overnight.5. Grease the idli molds with oil.6. Pour the batter into the molds and steam for 10-12 minutes.7. Remove from the molds and serve hot with chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Rice (2 cups), Urad Dal (1/2 cup), Pepper (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Ghee (2 tbsp), Curry Leaves (10), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak 2 cups of rice and 1/2 cup of urad dal in water for 6-8 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked rice and dal separately into a fine batter.3. Mix the two batters together, add salt to taste, and mix well.4. Let the batter ferment in a warm place for 8-12 hours or overnight.5. Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds, pepper, cashews, and curry leaves. Sauté until aromatic.6. Add this tempering to the batter and mix well.7. Grease idli molds with oil.8. Pour the batter into the molds and steam for 10-12 minutes.9. Remove from the molds and serve hot with chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Rice (2 cups), Urad Dal (1/2 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for tempering), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Chopped Vegetables (carrots, beans, etc.)
Recipe Steps: 1. Prepare plain idli batter and steam cook the idlis.2. Once cooled, cut the idlis into small pieces.3. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and curry leaves. Sauté until aromatic.4. Add chopped vegetables and sauté until cooked.5. Add the idli pieces to the pan, mix well, and cook for 2-3 minutes.6. Serve hot with chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Rice (2 cups), Urad Dal (1/2 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Ghee (2 tbsp), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Cumin Powder (1 tsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Prepare plain idli batter and steam cook the idlis.2. Once cooled, cut the idlis into small pieces.3. Heat ghee in a pan, add red chili powder and cumin powder. Sauté for a minute.4. Add the idli pieces to the pan, mix well, and cook for 2-3 minutes.5. Serve hot as a spicy snack.

Add grated coconut, sugar, yeast, and salt to the batter. Mix well.4. Let the batter ferment in a warm place for 8-12 hours or overnight.5. Grease idli molds with oil.6. Pour the batter into the molds and steam for 10-12 minutes.7. Remove from the molds and serve hot with chutney or spicy curry.

Ingredients: Puffed Rice (2 cups), Onions (1), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Peanuts (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chilies, and peanuts. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.3. Add turmeric powder and mix well.4. Add puffed rice and salt, mix gently to avoid breaking the rice.5. Cook for 2-3 minutes and serve hot with coconut chutney or pickle.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (2 cups), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix rice flour, salt, and water to form a dough-like consistency.2. Press the dough through an idiyappam maker to form thin noodles.3. Steam the noodles in an idli steamer for 5-7 minutes until cooked.4. Serve hot with coconut milk, sugar, or spicy curry.

Ingredients: Potatoes (2, boiled and mashed), Besan (1 cup), Onions (1), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Coriander Leaves (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add curry leaves, chopped onions, and green chilies. Sauté until onions are translucent.2. Add mashed potatoes, coriander leaves, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.3. Make small balls from the potato mixture.4. Prepare a thick batter using besan and water.5. Dip each potato ball into the batter and deep fry until golden brown.6. Serve hot with coconut chutney or spicy curry.

Ingredients: Urad Dal (1 cup), Coconut (1/2 cup, grated), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak urad dal in water for 4-5 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked dal into a fine batter.3. Add grated coconut, chopped green chilies, curry leaves, and salt. Mix well.4. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.5. Take a small portion of the mixture, shape it into a disc, and drop it into the hot oil.6. Fry until golden brown and crispy.7. Serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Besan (1 cup), Eggs (4), Onions (1), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Coriander Leaves (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Boil eggs and peel them. Keep aside.2. Heat oil in a pan, add curry leaves, chopped onions, and green chilies. Sauté until onions are translucent.3. Add coriander leaves and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.4. Prepare a thick batter using besan and water.5. Dip each boiled egg into the batter and deep fry until golden brown.6. Serve hot with spicy curry or chutney.

Ingredients: Besan (1 cup), Onions (2), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Coriander Leaves (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Chop onions into thin slices and keep aside.2. Mix besan, chopped green chilies, curry leaves, coriander leaves, and salt. Add water to make a thick batter.3. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.4. Drop spoonfuls of the batter into the hot oil and fry until golden brown.5. Serve hot with mint chutney or spicy curry.

Ingredients: Bread Slices (4), Potatoes (2, boiled and mashed), Besan (1 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Coriander Leaves (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add curry leaves, chopped green chilies, and coriander leaves. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add mashed potatoes and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.3. Spread the potato mixture on bread slices and cut into halves.4. Prepare a thick batter using besan and water.5. Dip each bread piece into the batter and deep fry until golden brown.6. Serve hot with spicy curry or chutney.

Ingredients: Basmati Rice (1 cup), Tomatoes (2, pureed), Onions (1), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.3. Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.4. Add turmeric powder, salt, and basmati rice. Mix well.5. Add 2 cups of water and cook until the rice is fully cooked.6. Serve hot with raita or pickle.

Ingredients: Rice (1 cup), Toor Dal (1/2 cup), Mixed Vegetables (carrots, beans, peas - 1 cup), Bisibele Bath Masala (2 tbsp), Tamarind Paste (1 tbsp), Jaggery (1 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Wash and soak rice and toor dal for 30 minutes.2. Heat oil in a pressure cooker, add bisibele bath masala and sauté until aromatic.3. Add mixed vegetables, tamarind paste, jaggery, and salt. Mix well.4. Add drained rice and dal, mix well.5. Add 3 cups of water and pressure cook for 3-4 whistles.6. Open the lid once the pressure releases and mix well.7. Serve hot with papad or raita.

Ingredients: Rava (1 cup), Sugar (1/2 cup), Water (2 cups), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Raisins (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat ghee in a pan, roast cashews and raisins until golden brown. Set aside.2. In the same pan, add water and sugar. Bring to a boil.3. Lower the heat and slowly add rava while stirring continuously.4. Cook until the rava is fully cooked and the mixture thickens.5. Add cardamom powder and mix well.6. Garnish with roasted cashews and raisins.7. Serve hot as a sweet dish.

Ingredients: Semolina (1 cup), Ghee (2 tbsp), Sugar (1/2 cup), Milk (1 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Raisins (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat ghee in a pan, roast cashews and raisins until golden brown. Set aside.2. In the same pan, roast semolina until aromatic.3. Add milk and cook until the semolina is fully cooked.4. Add sugar and cardamom powder. Mix well.5. Garnish with roasted cashews and raisins.6. Serve hot as a sweet dish.

Ingredients: Poha (1 cup), Sugar (1/2 cup), Water (2 cups), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Raisins (2 tbsp)

Recipe Steps: 1. Mix rice flour, sesame seeds, salt, and water to form a dough.2. Divide the dough into small balls and flatten them into thin discs.3. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.4. Fry the discs until golden brown and crispy.5. Serve with chutneys or pickle.

Recipe Steps: 1. Soak urad dal in water for 4-5 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked dal into a fine batter.3. Add chopped green chilies, curry leaves, and salt. Mix well.4. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.5. Wet your hands, take a small portion of the batter, shape it into a disc, and drop it into the hot oil.6. Fry until golden brown and crispy.7. Serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Dosa Batter (1 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Add chopped green chilies, curry leaves, and salt to the dosa batter. Mix well.2. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.3. Drop small portions of the batter into the hot oil and fry until golden brown.4. Serve hot with chutneys or pickle.

Ingredients: Sabudana (1 cup), Potatoes (2, boiled), Green Chilies (2), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak sabudana in water for 30 minutes, then drain.2. Mash boiled potatoes and mix with soaked sabudana, chopped green chilies, and salt.3. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.4. Take small portions of the mixture, shape them into balls, and drop them into the hot oil.5. Fry until golden brown and crispy.6. Serve hot with chutneys or pickle.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (2 cups), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix rice flour, salt, and water to form a dough.2. Divide the dough into small balls and flatten them into thin discs.3. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.4. Fry the discs until golden brown and crispy.5. Serve with chutneys or pickle.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (2 cups), Jaggery (1/2 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Dissolve jaggery in water and strain to remove impurities.2. Mix rice flour, salt, and jaggery syrup to form a dough.3. Shape the dough into small balls.4. Steam the balls for 10-12 minutes until cooked.5. Serve hot as a sweet snack.

Recipe Steps: Recipe Steps

Ingredients: Ragi Flour (1 cup), Water (2 cups), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix ragi flour and water in a pot.2. Cook on medium heat, stirring continuously to avoid lumps.3. Add salt to taste and cook until the mixture thickens.4. Serve hot with spicy curries or chutneys.

Ingredients: Jowar Flour (2 cups), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix jowar flour, salt, and water to form a dough.2. Knead the dough until smooth and let it rest for 30 minutes.3. Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into thin discs.4. Heat a tawa or griddle over medium heat.5. Cook the rolled rotis on the tawa, applying oil on both sides until golden brown.6. Serve hot with chutney or curry.

Ingredients: Bajra Flour (2 cups), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix bajra flour, salt, and water to form a dough.2. Knead the dough until smooth and let it rest for 30 minutes.3. Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into thin discs.4. Heat a tawa or griddle over medium heat.5. Cook the rolled rotis on the tawa, applying oil on both sides until golden brown.6. Serve hot with chutney or curry.

Ingredients: Foxtail Millet (1 cup), Water (2 cups), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Rinse foxtail millet thoroughly under running water.2. Add millet, water, and salt to a pot.3. Cook on medium heat until the millet is soft and fluffy.4. Serve hot as a light breakfast with yogurt or curry.

Ingredients: Rice (1/2 cup), Water (4 cups), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Rinse rice thoroughly under running water.2. Add rice, water, and salt to a pot.3. Cook on low heat until the rice breaks down and the porridge thickens.4. Serve hot as a nourishing meal.

Ingredients: Ragi Flour (1/2 cup), Water (4 cups), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix ragi flour and water in a pot.2. Cook on medium heat, stirring continuously to avoid lumps.3. Add salt to taste and cook until the mixture thickens.4. Serve hot as a nutritious porridge.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (1 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix rice flour, salt, and water to form a thick batter.2. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.3. Drop small portions of the batter into the hot oil and fry until golden brown.4. Serve hot as a snack with chutney.

Ingredients: Jowar Flour (1 cup), Mixed Vegetables (carrots, beans, peas - 1 cup), Water (2 cups), Oil (2 tbsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Green Chilies (2), Onion (1), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.3. Add mixed vegetables and cook for 5-7 minutes.4. Add water and salt, bring to a boil.5. Lower the heat and slowly add jowar flour while stirring continuously.6. Cook until the mixture thickens and water is absorbed.7. Serve hot with coconut chutney or pickle.

Ingredients: Ragi Flour (1 cup), Rice Flour (1/2 cup), Jaggery (1/4 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix ragi flour, rice flour, jaggery, and water to form a smooth batter.2. Add salt to taste and mix well.3. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.4. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it thinly.5. Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges of the dosa.6. Cook until the dosa turns golden brown and crispy.7. Fold the dosa and serve hot as a sweet dish.

Ingredients: Jowar Flour (1 cup), Rice Flour (1/2 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix jowar flour, rice flour, and water to form a smooth batter.2. Add salt to taste and mix well.3. Let the batter rest for 30 minutes.4. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.5. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it thinly.6. Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges of the dosa.7. Cook until the dosa turns golden brown and crispy.8. Fold the dosa and serve hot with chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Puffed Rice (2 cups), Onions (1), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Peanuts (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.3. Add turmeric powder and peanuts. Mix well.4. Add puffed rice and salt. Mix gently to avoid breaking the rice.5. Cook for 2-3 minutes and serve hot with pickle.

Ingredients: Beaten Rice (1 cup), Curd (1 cup), Salt (to taste), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Green Chilies (2), Cashews (2 tbsp), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak beaten rice in water for 5 minutes, then drain and set aside.2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic.3. Add cashews and roast until golden brown.4. Mix soaked beaten rice, curd, and salt. Add the tempering and mix well.5. Serve chilled as a refreshing dish.

Ingredients: Beaten Rice (1 cup), Water (2 cups), Oil (2 tbsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Green Chilies (2), Onion (1), Carrots (optional), Peas (optional), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak beaten rice in water for 5 minutes, then drain and set aside.2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic.3. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.4. Add chopped vegetables (if using) and cook for 2-3 minutes.5. Add soaked beaten rice, salt, and mix well.6. Cook for 2-3 minutes and serve hot with coconut chutney or pickle.

Ingredients: Beaten Rice (1 cup), Fresh Coconut (1/2 cup, grated), Sugar (2 tbsp), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak beaten rice in water for 5 minutes, then drain and set aside.2. In a pan, mix soaked beaten rice, grated coconut, sugar, and cardamom powder.3. Cook for 2-3 minutes on low heat.4. Serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Beaten Rice (1 cup), Jaggery (1/4 cup), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat ghee in a pan, roast cashews until golden brown. Set aside.2. In the same pan, add jaggery and a little water. Cook until the jaggery melts.3. Add soaked beaten rice and cardamom powder. Mix well.4. Garnish with roasted cashews.5. Serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Beaten Rice (1 cup), Tamarind Paste (1 tbsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Green Chilies (2), Peanuts (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak beaten rice in water for 5 minutes, then drain and set aside.2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic.3. Add peanuts and roast until golden brown.4. Add tamarind paste, salt, and soaked beaten rice. Mix well.5. Cook for 2-3 minutes and serve hot as a tangy snack.

Recipe Steps: Recipe Steps

Ingredients: Chicken (500g), Gongura Leaves (1 cup), Basmati Rice (2 cups), Onion (2), Tomato (2), Garlic (4 cloves), Ginger (1-inch piece), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Coriander Powder (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Garam Masala (1 tsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions, garlic, and ginger. Sauté until golden brown.3. Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.4. Add chicken pieces and cook for 10-15 minutes until tender.5. Add gongura leaves and cook for another 5 minutes.6. Add cooked basmati rice and garam masala. Mix well and simmer for 5 minutes.7. Serve hot with raita or pickle.

Ingredients: Mutton (500g), Basmati Rice (2 cups), Onion (2), Tomato (2), Garlic (4 cloves), Ginger (1-inch piece), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Coriander Powder (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Garam Masala (1 tsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Marinate mutton with red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt for 30 minutes.2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Sauté until aromatic.3. Add chopped onions, garlic, and ginger. Sauté until golden brown.4. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until oil separates.5. Add marinated mutton and cook for 20-25 minutes until tender.6. In a separate pot, layer cooked basmati rice and mutton mixture.7. Seal the pot with dough and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes (dum cooking).8. Serve hot with raita or pickle.

Ingredients: Lamb (500g), Basmati Rice (2 cups), Onion (2), Tomato (2), Garlic (4 cloves), Ginger (1-inch piece), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Coriander Powder (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Garam Masala (1 tsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions, garlic, and ginger. Sauté until golden brown.3. Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.4. Add lamb pieces and cook for 20-25 minutes until tender.5. Add cooked basmati rice and garam masala. Mix well and simmer for 5 minutes.6. Serve hot with raita or pickle.

Add marinated mutton and cook for 20-25 minutes until tender.6. In a separate pot, layer cooked ragi rice and mutton mixture.7. Seal the pot with dough and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes (dum cooking).8. Serve hot with raita or pickle.

Ingredients: Minced Meat (500g), Raw Mango (1), Basmati Rice (2 cups), Onion (2), Tomato (2), Garlic (4 cloves), Ginger (1-inch piece), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Coriander Powder (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Garam Masala (1 tsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions, garlic, and ginger. Sauté until golden brown.3. Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.4. Add minced meat and cook for 15-20 minutes until tender.5. Add raw mango slices and cook for another 5 minutes.6. Add cooked basmati rice and garam masala. Mix well and simmer for 5 minutes.7. Serve hot with raita or pickle.

Ingredients: Chicken (500g), Jowar (2 cups), Onion (2), Tomato (2), Garlic (4 cloves), Ginger (1-inch piece), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Coriander Powder (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Garam Masala (1 tsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions, garlic, and ginger. Sauté until golden brown.3. Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.4. Add chicken pieces and cook for 15-20 minutes until tender.5. Add cooked jowar and garam masala. Mix well and simmer for 5 minutes.6. Serve hot with raita or pickle.

Ingredients: Brinjal (4), Basmati Rice (2 cups), Onion (2), Tomato (2), Garlic (4 cloves), Ginger (1-inch piece), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Coriander Powder (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Garam Masala (1 tsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Stuff brinjals with a mix of red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt.2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Sauté until aromatic.3. Add chopped onions, garlic, and ginger. Sauté until golden brown.4. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until oil separates.5. Add stuffed brinjals and cook for 15-20 minutes until tender.6. In a separate pot, layer cooked basmati rice and brinjal mixture.7. Seal the pot with dough and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes (dum cooking).8. Serve hot with raita or pickle.

Ingredients: Country Chicken (500g), Ragi Rice (2 cups), Onion (2), Tomato (2), Garlic (4 cloves), Ginger (1-inch piece), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Coriander Powder (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Garam Masala (1 tsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions, garlic, and ginger. Sauté until golden brown.3. Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.4. Add country chicken pieces and cook for 20-25 minutes until tender.5. Add cooked ragi rice and garam masala. Mix well and simmer for 5 minutes.6. Serve hot with raita or pickle.

Ingredients: Chicken (500g), Basmati Rice (2 cups), Avakaya Pickle (2 tbsp), Onion (2), Tomato (2), Garlic (4 cloves), Ginger (1-inch piece), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Coriander Powder (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Garam Masala (1 tsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Marinate chicken with avakaya pickle, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt for 30 minutes.2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Sauté until aromatic.3. Add chopped onions, garlic, and ginger. Sauté until golden brown.4. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until oil separates.5. Add marinated chicken and cook for 20-25 minutes until tender.6. In a separate pot, layer cooked basmati rice and chicken mixture.7. Seal the pot with dough and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes (dum cooking).8. Serve hot with raita or pickle.

Ingredients: Paya (Trotters, 500g), Basmati Rice (2 cups), Onion (2), Tomato (2), Garlic (4 cloves), Ginger (1-inch piece), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Coriander Powder (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Garam Masala (1 tsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Clean and boil paya until tender. Set aside.2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Sauté until aromatic.3. Add chopped onions, garlic, and ginger. Sauté until golden brown.4. Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.5. Add boiled paya and cook for 10-15 minutes.6. Add cooked basmati rice and garam masala. Mix well and simmer for 5 minutes.7. Serve hot with raita or pickle.

Ingredients: Maida (2 cups), Sugar Syrup (1 cup), Ghee (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Make a dough with maida, ghee, and water.2. Roll out thin sheets of dough and fold them into kaja shapes.3. Deep fry in oil until golden brown and crispy.4. Dip the fried kajas in sugar syrup and garnish with cardamom powder.5. Cool and store in an airtight container.

Ingredients: Peanuts (1 cup), Jaggery (1/2 cup), Ghee (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Roast peanuts until golden brown. Remove skins and set aside.2. Heat jaggery and ghee in a pan until it forms a thick syrup.3. Add roasted peanuts to the syrup and mix well.4. Pour the mixture onto a greased surface and flatten it.5. Cut into pieces once cooled and store in an airtight container.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (1 cup), Jaggery (1/2 cup), Coconut (1/2 cup, grated), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Dissolve jaggery in water and strain to remove impurities.2. Heat ghee in a pan, add rice flour and roast until aromatic.3. Add jaggery syrup, grated coconut, and cardamom powder. Mix well.4. Cook until the mixture thickens and forms a dough-like consistency.5. Shape into sweets and cool before serving.

Ingredients: Wheat Flour (1 cup), Sugar (1 cup), Milk (1 cup), Ghee (1/2 cup), Nuts (cashews, almonds), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat ghee in a pan, roast wheat flour until golden brown.2. Add milk and sugar, and cook until the mixture thickens.3. Add roasted nuts and cardamom powder. Mix well.4. Cook until the halwa reaches a soft, sticky consistency.5. Serve hot or cold as a dessert.

Ingredients: Chana Dal (1 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Coriander Leaves (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak chana dal overnight and grind into a coarse paste.2. Add green chilies, curry leaves, coriander leaves, and salt. Mix well.3. Shape into small balls and deep fry in oil until golden brown.4. Serve hot with chutney or sauce.

Ingredients: Ragi Flour (1 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Ghee (1 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix ragi flour with water to form a dough.2. Shape the dough into small balls and steam them.3. Serve hot with spicy curry or chutney.

Ingredients: Soda Water (1 liter), Lemon Juice (1/4 cup), Sugar Syrup (1/4 cup), Ice Cubes (as needed)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix soda water, lemon juice, and sugar syrup in a jug.2. Add ice cubes and stir well.3. Serve chilled as a refreshing drink.

Ingredients: Mutton (500g), Onion (2), Tomato (2), Garlic (4 cloves), Ginger (1-inch piece), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Coriander Powder (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Garam Masala (1 tsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions, garlic, and ginger. Sauté until golden brown.3. Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.4. Add mutton pieces and cook for 20-25 minutes until tender.5. Garnish with garam masala and serve hot.

Ingredients: Besan (1 cup), Sugar Syrup (1 cup), Ghee (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Nuts (cashews, almonds)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat ghee in a pan, roast besan until golden brown.2. Add sugar syrup and mix well.3. Add cardamom powder and roasted nuts. Mix well.4. Shape into laddus while the mixture is still warm.5. Cool and store in an airtight container.

Ingredients: Maida (2 cups), Sugar Syrup (1 cup), Ghee (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Make a dough with maida, ghee, and water.2. Roll out thin sheets of dough and fold them into kaja shapes.3. Deep fry in oil until golden brown and crispy.4. Dip the fried kajas in sugar syrup and garnish with cardamom powder.5. Cool and store in an airtight container.

Ingredients: Corn (2 cups, boiled), Onion (1), Tomato (1), Green Chilies (2), Chaat Masala (1 tsp), Lemon Juice (1 tbsp), Coriander Leaves (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix boiled corn, chopped onions, tomatoes, green chilies, chaat masala, lemon juice, and salt.2. Garnish with coriander leaves.3. Serve as a street-style snack.

Ingredients: Pav (4), Mixed Vegetables (2 cups), Onion (1), Tomato (2), Garlic (4 cloves), Ginger (1-inch piece), Pav Bhaji Masala (2 tsp), Butter (2 tbsp), Lemon Juice (1 tbsp), Coriander Leaves (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat butter in a pan, add chopped onions, garlic, and ginger. Sauté until golden brown.2. Add chopped tomatoes and pav bhaji masala. Cook until oil separates.3. Add boiled mixed vegetables and mash them into the mixture.4. Add lemon juice and salt. Mix well.5. Serve hot with toasted pav and garnish with coriander leaves.

Ingredients: Chana Dal (1 cup), Coriander Leaves (1/2 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Pav (4), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak chana dal overnight and grind into a coarse paste.2. Add coriander leaves, green chilies, curry leaves, and salt. Mix well.3. Shape into small balls and deep fry in oil until golden brown.4. Serve hot with pav and chutney.

Ingredients: Maggie Noodles (2 packs), Onion (1), Tomato (1), Green Chilies (2), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Coriander Leaves (2 tbsp), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Boil maggie noodles according to package instructions.2. Heat oil in a pan, add chopped onions, tomatoes, and green chilies. Sauté until soft.3. Add red chili powder, salt, and boiled noodles. Mix well.4. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

Ingredients: Rice (2 cups, cooked), Eggs (2), Onion (1), Carrots (1/2 cup, diced), Beans (1/2 cup, chopped), Green Chilies (2), Soy Sauce (2 tbsp), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, scramble eggs and set aside.2. In the same pan, add chopped onions, carrots, beans, and green chilies. Sauté until soft.3. Add cooked rice, scrambled eggs, soy sauce, and salt. Mix well.4. Stir-fry for 5-7 minutes and serve hot.

Ingredients: Rice (2 cups), Urad Dal (1/2 cup), Biryani Masala (1 tsp), Onion (1), Tomato (1), Green Chilies (2), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Prepare dosa batter by soaking and grinding rice and urad dal.2. Add biryani masala, chopped onions, tomatoes, green chilies, and salt to the batter.3. Spread the batter on a hot griddle and cook until crispy.4. Serve hot with chutney or curry.

Ingredients: Prawns (500g), Garlic (6 cloves), Butter (2 tbsp), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Coriander Powder (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat butter in a pan, add chopped garlic and curry leaves. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add prawns, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook until prawns are tender.3. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

Ingredients: Green Chilies (10), Gram Flour (1 cup), Rice Flour (2 tbsp), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Slit green chilies lengthwise without removing seeds.2. Mix gram flour, rice flour, red chili powder, cumin seeds, and salt with water to form a thick batter.3. Dip each chili into the batter and deep fry in oil until golden brown.4. Serve hot with chutney or sauce.

Ingredients: Jowar Flour (1 cup), Water (as needed), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix jowar flour, red chili powder, cumin seeds, and salt with water to form a dough.2. Roll out small portions of the dough into thin discs and cut them into triangle shapes.3. Deep fry the triangles in oil until crispy and golden brown.4. Serve hot with salsa or dip.

Ingredients: Green Gram (1 cup), Rice (1/4 cup), Pizza Sauce (2 tbsp), Cheese (grated, 1/4 cup), Veggies (chopped, bell peppers, onions, etc.), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak green gram and rice in water for 6-8 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked green gram and rice into a fine batter.3. Add salt to taste and mix well.4. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.5. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it thinly.6. Spread pizza sauce evenly over the pesarattu.7. Sprinkle grated cheese and chopped veggies over the pesarattu.8. Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges of the pesarattu.9. Cook until the pesarattu turns golden brown and the cheese melts.10. Fold the pesarattu and serve hot as a fusion dish.

Ingredients: Rava (1 cup), Water (2 cups), Oil (2 tbsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Green Chilies (2), Onion (1), Carrots (optional), Peas (optional), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.3. Add chopped vegetables (if using) and cook for 2-3 minutes.4. Add water and salt, bring to a boil.5. Lower the heat and slowly add rava while stirring continuously.6. Cook until the rava is fully cooked and the water is absorbed.7. Serve hot with coconut chutney or pickle.

Ingredients: Rava (1 cup), Mixed Vegetables (carrots, beans, peas - 1 cup), Water (2 cups), Oil (2 tbsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Green Chilies (2), Onion (1), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.3. Add mixed vegetables and cook for 5-7 minutes.4. Add water and salt, bring to a boil.5. Lower the heat and slowly add rava while stirring continuously.6. Cook until the rava is fully cooked and the water is absorbed.7. Serve hot with coconut chutney or pickle.

Ingredients: Rava (1 cup), Tomatoes (2, pureed), Water (2 cups), Oil (2 tbsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Green Chilies (2), Onion (1), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.3. Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.4. Add water and salt, bring to a boil.5. Lower the heat and slowly add rava while stirring continuously.6. Cook until the rava is fully cooked and the water is absorbed.7. Serve hot with coconut chutney or pickle.

Ingredients: Poha (1 cup), Water (2 cups), Oil (2 tbsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Green Chilies (2), Onion (1), Carrots (optional), Peas (optional), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak poha in water for 5 minutes, then drain and set aside.2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic.3. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.4. Add chopped vegetables (if using) and cook for 2-3 minutes.5. Add soaked poha, salt, and mix well.6. Cook for 2-3 minutes and serve hot with coconut chutney or pickle.

Ingredients: Oats (1 cup), Water (2 cups), Oil (2 tbsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Green Chilies (2), Onion (1), Carrots (optional), Peas (optional), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.3. Add chopped vegetables (if using) and cook for 2-3 minutes.4. Add water and salt, bring to a boil.5. Add oats and cook until fully cooked and water is absorbed.6. Serve hot with coconut chutney or pickle.

Ingredients: Ragi Flour (1 cup), Water (2 cups), Oil (2 tbsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Green Chilies (2), Onion (1), Carrots (optional), Peas (optional), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.3. Add chopped vegetables (if using) and cook for 2-3 minutes.4. Add water and salt, bring to a boil.5. Lower the heat and slowly add ragi flour while stirring continuously.6. Cook until the mixture thickens and water is absorbed.7. Serve hot with coconut chutney or pickle.

Ingredients: Rava (1 cup), Sugar (1/2 cup), Water (2 cups), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Raisins (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat ghee in a pan, roast cashews and raisins until golden brown. Set aside.2. In the same pan, add water and sugar. Bring to a boil.3. Lower the heat and slowly add rava while stirring continuously.4. Cook until the rava is fully cooked and the mixture thickens.5. Add cardamom powder and mix well.6. Garnish with roasted cashews and raisins.7. Serve hot as a sweet dish.

Ingredients: Vermicelli (1 cup), Water (2 cups), Oil (2 tbsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Green Chilies (2), Onion (1), Carrots (optional), Peas (optional), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Roast vermicelli in a dry pan until golden brown. Set aside.2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic.3. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.4. Add chopped vegetables (if using) and cook for 2-3 minutes.5. Add water and salt, bring to a boil.6. Add roasted vermicelli and cook until fully cooked and water is absorbed.7. Serve hot with coconut chutney or pickle.

Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.3. Add chopped vegetables (if using) and cook for 2-3 minutes.4. Add water and salt, bring to a boil.5. Add broken wheat and cook until fully cooked and water is absorbed.6. Serve hot with coconut chutney or pickle.

Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.3. Ingredients: Rice (1 cup), Moong Dal (1/2 cup), Water (4 cups), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Pepper (1 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Ginger (1-inch piece, grated), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Wash and soak rice and moong dal for 30 minutes.2. Heat ghee in a pressure cooker, add cumin seeds, pepper, and cashews. Sauté until aromatic.3. Add grated ginger and sauté for a minute.4. Add drained rice and dal, sauté for 2-3 minutes.5. Add water and salt, pressure cook for 3-4 whistles.6. Open the lid once the pressure releases and mix well.7. Serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Rava (1 cup), Moong Dal (1/2 cup), Water (4 cups), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Pepper (1 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Ginger (1-inch piece, grated), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds, pepper, and cashews. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add grated ginger and sauté for a minute.3. Add washed moong dal and sauté for 2-3 minutes.4. Add water and salt, bring to a boil.5. Lower the heat and slowly add rava while stirring continuously.6. Cook until the rava is fully cooked and the mixture thickens.7. Serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Rice (1 cup), Moong Dal (1/2 cup), Jaggery (1/2 cup), Milk (2 cups), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Raisins (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Wash and soak rice and moong dal for 30 minutes.2. Heat ghee in a pan, roast cashews and raisins until golden brown. Set aside.3. In the same pan, add milk, jaggery, and drained rice and dal. Cook until soft.4. Add cardamom powder and mix well.5. Garnish with roasted cashews and raisins.6. Serve hot as a sweet dish.

Ingredients: Urad Dal (1 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak urad dal in water for 4-5 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked dal into a fine batter.3. Add salt to taste and mix well.4. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.5. Wet your hands, take a small portion of the batter, shape it into a disc, and drop it into the hot oil.6. Fry until golden brown and crispy.7. Serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Chana Dal (1 cup), Onions (2), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Coriander Leaves (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak chana dal in water for 4-5 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked dal into a coarse paste.3. Add chopped onions, green chilies, curry leaves, coriander leaves, and salt. Mix well.4. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.5. Take a small portion of the mixture, shape it into a disc, and drop it into the hot oil.6. Fry until golden brown and crispy.7. Serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Wheat Flour (2 cups), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix wheat flour, salt, and water to form a dough.2. Knead the dough until smooth and let it rest for 30 minutes.3. Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into thin discs.4. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.5. Drop the rolled puris into the hot oil and fry until they puff up and turn golden brown.6. Serve hot with potato curry or pickle.

Ingredients: Wheat Flour (2 cups), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying), Potatoes (2), Onion (1), Green Chilies (2), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Prepare plain puris as described above.2. For the masala filling, boil potatoes until tender. Peel and mash them.3. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, chopped onions, and green chilies. Sauté until onions are translucent.4. Add turmeric powder, mashed potatoes, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.5. Serve the puris with the masala filling and spicy curry.

Ingredients: Wheat Flour (2 cups), Boiled Potatoes (2), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix wheat flour, mashed boiled potatoes, salt, and water to form a dough.2. Knead the dough until smooth and let it rest for 30 minutes.3. Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into thin discs.4. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.5. Drop the rolled puris into the hot oil and fry until they puff up and turn golden brown.6. Serve hot with potato curry or pickle.

Ingredients: Toor Dal (1/2 cup), Mixed Vegetables (1 cup), Tamarind Juice (1/4 cup), Sambar Powder (2 tsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Cook toor dal with water until soft.2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Sauté until aromatic.3. Add chopped vegetables, tamarind juice, sambar powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until vegetables are tender.4. Mix cooked dal with the vegetable mixture and simmer for 5 minutes.5. Serve hot with rice or idli.

Ingredients: Brinjal (2), Coriander Leaves (1/2 cup), Green Chilies (2), Ginger (1-inch piece), Tamarind Juice (1/4 cup), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Chop brinjals into small pieces and cook with tamarind juice until soft.2. Blend coriander leaves, green chilies, and ginger into a paste.3. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and sauté until aromatic.4. Add the coriander paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook for 2 minutes.5. Mix with cooked brinjals and serve hot with rice.

Ingredients: Horse Gram (1/2 cup), Tamarind Juice (1/4 cup), Rasam Powder (2 tsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)

Add tamarind juice, rasam powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Simmer for 10 minutes.4. Add cooked horse gram and mix well.5. Serve hot with rice.

Ingredients: Ponnaganti Leaves (1/2 cup), Tamarind Juice (1/4 cup), Pulusu Powder (2 tsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Wash and chop the ponnaganti leaves finely and set aside.2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Sauté until aromatic.3. Add chopped ponnaganti leaves and sauté for 2-3 minutes until wilted.4. Add tamarind juice, turmeric powder, red chili powder, pulusu powder, and salt. Mix well.5. Cook on medium heat for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the gravy thickens.6. Adjust the consistency by adding water if needed.7. Simmer for another 5 minutes and turn off the heat.8. Serve hot with steamed rice or as a side dish.

Ingredients: Ridge Gourd (1), Tamarind Juice (1/4 cup), Pulusu Powder (2 tsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)

Serve hot with steamed rice.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (1 cup), Sesame Seeds (2 tbsp), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix rice flour, salt, chopped green chilies, curry leaves, and sesame seeds in a bowl. 2. Add water gradually to form a dough-like consistency. 3. Heat oil in a pan, spread the mixture evenly to form a thick pancake. 4. Cook on low heat until crispy and golden brown on both sides. 5. Serve hot with chutney or pickle.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (2 cups), Sesame Seeds (2 tbsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix rice flour, sesame seeds, cumin seeds, red chili powder, and salt. 2. Add water gradually to form a stiff dough. 3. Shape the dough into small rings or spirals. 4. Deep fry the shapes in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. 5. Drain on absorbent paper and serve as a savory snack.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (2 cups), Urad Dal (1/2 cup), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak urad dal overnight and grind into a fine paste. 2. Mix rice flour, urad dal paste, cumin seeds, red chili powder, and salt. 3. Add water gradually to form a stiff dough. 4. Use a murukulu maker to shape the dough into spiral-shaped snacks. 5. Deep fry the shapes in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. 6. Drain on absorbent paper and serve as a savory snack.

Deep fry the vadas in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. 5. Drain on absorbent paper and serve as a savory snack.

Ingredients: Green Gram (1 cup), Green Chilies (2), Ginger (1 inch), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak green gram overnight and grind into a fine batter. 2. Add chopped green chilies, ginger, curry leaves, and salt to the batter. 3. Heat a tawa or griddle over medium heat. 4. Spread the batter evenly to form a thin dosa. 5. Cook on both sides, applying oil as needed, until golden brown. 6. Serve hot with chutney or pickle.

Ingredients: Urad Dal (1 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Ginger (1 inch), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak urad dal overnight and grind into a fine paste. 2. Add chopped green chilies, curry leaves, ginger, and salt to the paste. 3. Shape the mixture into small vadas with a hole in the center. 4. Deep fry the vadas in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. 5. Drain on absorbent paper and serve as a savory snack.

Ingredients: Potato (2, boiled), Besan (1 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Ginger (1 inch), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Boil and mash potatoes. 2. Mix mashed potatoes with chopped green chilies, curry leaves, ginger, and salt. 3. Shape the mixture into small balls. 4. Coat the balls with besan batter. 5. Deep fry the bondas in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. 6. Drain on absorbent paper and serve as a savory snack.

Ingredients: Green Chilies (5), Besan (1 cup), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Slit green chilies lengthwise without separating them. 2. Mix besan, red chili powder, and salt with water to form a thick batter. 3. Dip the green chilies into the batter. 4. Deep fry the bajjis in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. 5. Drain on absorbent paper and serve as a spicy snack.

Ingredients: Rice (1 cup), Urad Dal (1/2 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Ginger (1 inch), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak rice and urad dal overnight and grind into a fine batter. 2. Add chopped green chilies, curry leaves, ginger, and salt to the batter. 3. Heat oil in a pan and drop small portions of the batter into the oil. 4. Deep fry the punugulu until golden brown and crispy. 5. Drain on absorbent paper and serve as a savory snack.

Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and chopped onions. Sauté until aromatic. 2. Add chopped green chilies, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well. 3. Add puffed rice and mix gently to avoid breaking the rice. 4. Cook for 2-3 minutes and serve hot with pickle or papad.

Deep fry the pakodis in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. 5. Drain on absorbent paper and serve as a savory snack.

Ingredients: Urad Dal (1 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Ginger (1 inch), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak urad dal overnight and grind into a fine paste. 2. Add chopped green chilies, curry leaves, ginger, and salt to the paste. 3. Shape the mixture into small vadas with a hole in the center. 4. Deep fry the garelu in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. 5. Drain on absorbent paper and serve as a savory snack.

Ingredients: Lemon (2), Besan (1 cup), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Slice lemons thinly. 2. Mix besan, red chili powder, and salt with water to form a thick batter. 3. Dip the lemon slices into the batter. 4. Deep fry the bajjis in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. 5. Drain on absorbent paper and serve as a tangy snack.

Dish Name: Ragi Sangati with Natu Kodi Pulusu
Ingredients: Ragi Flour (1 cup), Chicken (1/2 kg), Tamarind Paste (2 tbsp), Garlic (2 cloves), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix ragi flour with water to form a dough. 2. Roll the dough into small balls and cook them in boiling water until soft. 3. Heat oil in a pan, add garlic and curry leaves. Sauté until aromatic. 4. Add chicken, tamarind paste, and salt. Cook until the chicken is tender. 5. Serve ragi sangati with natu kodi pulusu.

Ingredients: Groundnuts (1 cup), Salt (to taste), Water (as needed)
Recipe Steps: 1. Wash groundnuts thoroughly. 2. Boil groundnuts in salted water until soft. 3. Drain the water and serve as a healthy snack.

Ingredients: Ridge Gourd (1), Besan (1 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Grate ridge gourd and squeeze out excess water. 2. Mix grated gourd with besan, chopped green chilies, curry leaves, and salt. 3. Shape the mixture into small balls. 4. Deep fry the vundalu in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. 5. Drain on absorbent paper and serve as a savory snack.

Ingredients: Green Chilies (5), Lemon Juice (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Slit green chilies lengthwise without separating them. 2. Mix lemon juice and salt to form a marinade. 3. Marinate the green chilies in the mixture for 30 minutes. 4. Serve as a tangy and spicy snack.

Ingredients: Onion (1), Urad Dal (1 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak urad dal overnight and grind into a fine paste. 2. Add chopped onions, green chilies, curry leaves, and salt to the paste. 3. Shape the mixture into small vadas with a hole in the center. 4. Deep fry the garelu in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. 5. Drain on absorbent paper and serve as a savory snack.

Ingredients: Pani Puri Shells (10), Tamarind Paste (2 tbsp), Green Chilies (2), Mint Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Water (as needed)
Recipe Steps: 1. Prepare a spicy tamarind water by mixing tamarind paste, chopped green chilies, mint leaves, and salt with water. 2. Fill each pani puri shell with the spicy water. 3. Serve immediately as a tangy and spicy snack.

Ingredients: Green Chilies (5), Curd (1 cup), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Slit green chilies lengthwise without separating them. 2. Mix curd and salt to form a marinade. 3. Marinate the green chilies in the mixture for 30 minutes. 4. Serve as a cooling and tangy snack.

Recipe Steps: 1. Heat jaggery with a little water until melted. 2. Mix rice flour, grated coconut, cardamom powder, and melted jaggery. 3. Add water to form a dough-like consistency. 4. Shape the dough into small balls and steam them for 10-15 minutes. 5. Serve hot as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (2 cups), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix rice flour, red chili powder, and salt. 2. Add water gradually to form a stiff dough. 3. Shape the dough into small discs or crescents. 4. Deep fry the shapes in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. 5. Drain on absorbent paper and serve as a spicy snack.

Ingredients: Urad Dal (1 cup), Curd (1/2 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)

Shape the mixture into small vadas with a hole in the center. 4. Deep fry the garelu in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. 5. Drain on absorbent paper and serve as a savory snack.
