Ingredients: Amaranth Leaves (1 cup), Besan (1 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Chop amaranth leaves finely. 2. Mix besan, chopped green chilies, curry leaves, and salt with water to form a thick batter. 3. Add the chopped leaves to the batter. 4. Drop small portions of the batter into hot oil and deep fry until golden brown and crispy. 5. Drain on absorbent paper and serve as a savory snack.

Ingredients: Urad Dal (1 cup), Sesame Seeds (2 tbsp), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak urad dal overnight and grind into a fine paste. 2. Add sesame seeds, chopped green chilies, curry leaves, and salt to the paste. 3. Shape the mixture into small vadas with a hole in the center. 4. Deep fry the vadas in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. 5. Drain on absorbent paper and serve as a savory snack.

Ingredients: Corn (1 cup), Besan (1 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Boil corn kernels and mash them slightly. 2. Mix besan, mashed corn, chopped green chilies, curry leaves, and salt. 3. Add water to form a thick batter. 4. Drop small portions of the batter into hot oil and deep fry until golden brown and crispy. 5. Drain on absorbent paper and serve as a savory snack.

Ingredients: Moong Dal (1 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Ginger (1 inch), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak moong dal overnight and grind into a fine paste. 2. Add chopped green chilies, curry leaves, ginger, and salt to the paste. 3. Shape the mixture into small vadas with a hole in the center. 4. Deep fry the vadas in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. 5. Drain on absorbent paper and serve as a savory snack.

Ingredients: Fenugreek Leaves (1 cup), Besan (1 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Chop fenugreek leaves finely. 2. Mix besan, chopped green chilies, curry leaves, and salt with water to form a thick batter. 3. Add the chopped leaves to the batter. 4. Drop small portions of the batter into hot oil and deep fry until golden brown and crispy. 5. Drain on absorbent paper and serve as a savory snack.

Ingredients: Ingredients
Recipe Steps: Recipe Steps

Ingredients: Rice (2 cups), Urad Dal (1/2 cup), Eggs (4), Onion (1), Green Chilies (2), Oil (for cooking), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak rice and urad dal in water for 6-8 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked rice and dal separately into a fine batter.3. Mix the two batters together, add salt to taste, and mix well.4. Let the batter ferment in a warm place for 8-12 hours or overnight.5. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.6. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it thinly.7. Crack an egg onto the center of the dosa and spread it gently over the surface.8. Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges of the dosa.9. Cook until the dosa turns golden brown and crispy.10. Fold the dosa and serve hot with chutney or spicy curry.

Ingredients: Jowar Flour (1 cup), Rice (1/2 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak 1/2 cup of rice in water for 4-5 hours.2. Grind the soaked rice into a fine paste and mix it with 1 cup of jowar flour.3. Add water to make a smooth batter, add salt to taste, and mix well.4. Let the batter rest for 2-3 hours.5. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.6. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it thinly.7. Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges of the dosa.8. Cook until the dosa turns golden brown and crispy.9. Fold the dosa and serve hot with chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Idly Rava (1 cup), Toor Dal (1/2 cup), Tomatoes (2, pureed), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for greasing)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak idly rava and toor dal in water for 4-5 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked rava and dal with tomato puree into a fine batter.3. Add salt to taste and mix well.4. Let the batter ferment in a warm place for 8-12 hours or overnight.5. Grease idly molds and pour the batter into them.6. Steam the idlies for 10-12 minutes.7. Serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Rice (2 cups), Urad Dal (1/2 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking), Potatoes (2), Onion (1), Green Chilies (2), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Chettinad Masala (1 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak rice and urad dal in water for 6-8 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked rice and dal separately into a fine batter.3. Mix the two batters together, add salt to taste, and mix well.4. Let the batter ferment in a warm place for 8-12 hours or overnight.5. For the masala filling, boil potatoes until tender. Peel and mash them.6. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, chopped onions, and green chilies. Sauté until onions are translucent.7. Add turmeric powder, mashed potatoes, Chettinad masala, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.8. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.9. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it thinly.10. Place a portion of the potato masala in the center of the dosa.11. Fold the dosa over the filling and cook for another minute.12. Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

Ingredients: Green Chilies (6), Besan Flour (1 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Slit green chilies lengthwise without separating the halves.2. In a bowl, mix besan flour, water, salt, and red chili powder to form a thick batter.3. Dip each slit green chili into the batter, ensuring it is fully coated.4. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.5. Drop the coated chilies into the hot oil and fry until golden brown and crispy.6. Serve hot with coconut chutney or sauce.

Ingredients: Idly Rava (1 cup), Horse Gram (1/2 cup, soaked), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for greasing)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak idly rava and horse gram in water for 4-5 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked rava and horse gram into a fine batter.3. Add salt to taste and mix well.4. Let the batter ferment in a warm place for 8-12 hours or overnight.5. Grease idly molds and pour the batter into them.6. Steam the idlies for 10-12 minutes.7. Serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Rice (2 cups), Urad Dal (1/2 cup), Avakaya Pickle (2 tbsp), Curd (1/2 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak rice and urad dal in water for 6-8 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked rice and dal separately into a fine batter.3. Mix the two batters together, add curd, avakaya pickle, salt, and mix well.4. Let the batter ferment in a warm place for 8-12 hours or overnight.5. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.6. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it thinly.7. Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges of the dosa.8. Cook until the dosa turns golden brown and crispy.9. Fold the dosa and serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Rava (1 cup), Rice Flour (1/4 cup), Ginger Garlic Paste (1 tbsp), Green Chilies (2), Onion (1), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix rava, rice flour, ginger garlic paste, chopped onions, green chilies, salt, and water to form a batter.2. Let the batter rest for 30 minutes.3. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.4. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it thinly.5. Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges of the dosa.6. Cook until the dosa turns golden brown and crispy.7. Fold the dosa and serve hot with ginger chutney or coconut chutney.

Ingredients: Rava (1 cup), Karivepaku Chutney (2 tbsp), Water (2 cups), Oil (2 tbsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Green Chilies (2), Onion (1), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.3. Add water and salt, bring to a boil.4. Lower the heat and slowly add rava while stirring continuously.5. Add karivepaku chutney and mix well.6. Cook until the rava is fully cooked and the water is absorbed.7. Serve hot with coconut chutney or pickle.

Ingredients: Rava (1 cup), Sweet Corn Kernels (1/2 cup), Water (2 cups), Oil (2 tbsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Green Chilies (2), Onion (1), Salt (to taste), Coriander Powder (1 tsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.3. Add sweet corn kernels and cook for 2-3 minutes.4. Add water and salt, bring to a boil.5. Lower the heat and slowly add rava while stirring continuously.6. Add coriander powder and mix well.7. Cook until the rava is fully cooked and the water is absorbed.8. Serve hot with coconut chutney or pickle.

Ingredients: Rava (1 cup), Green Chilies (6), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)
Recipe Steps: 1. Slit green chilies lengthwise without separating the halves.2. Mix rava, water, and salt to form a thick batter.3. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.4. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it thinly.5. Place slit green chilies on top of the dosa.6. Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges of the dosa.7. Cook until the dosa turns golden brown and crispy.8. Fold the dosa and serve hot with coconut chutney or sauce.

Ingredients: Wheat Flour (2 cups), Boiled Potatoes (2), Onion (1), Green Chilies (2), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Prepare the masala filling: Boil potatoes until tender. Peel and mash them.2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, chopped onions, and green chilies. Sauté until onions are translucent.3. Add turmeric powder, mashed potatoes, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.4. Mix wheat flour, salt, and water to form a dough.5. Knead the dough until smooth and let it rest for 30 minutes.6. Divide the dough into small balls, flatten them, and stuff with the masala filling.7. Roll them into thin discs.8. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.9. Drop the rolled puris into the hot oil and fry until they puff up and turn golden brown.10. Serve hot with potato curry or pickle.

Ingredients: Green Gram (1 cup), Horse Gram (1/2 cup), Rice (1/4 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak 1 cup of green gram, 1/2 cup of horse gram, and 1/4 cup of rice in water for 6-8 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked grains into a fine batter.3. Add salt to taste and mix well.4. Let the batter rest for 30 minutes.5. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.6. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it thinly.7. Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges of the dosa.8. Cook until the dosa turns golden brown and crispy.9. Fold the dosa and serve hot with ginger chutney or coconut chutney.

Ingredients: Idly Rava (1 cup), Ponnaganti Leaves (1/2 cup, chopped), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for greasing)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak idly rava in water for 15-20 minutes. Drain and set aside.2. In a bowl, mix idly rava, chopped ponnaganti leaves, salt, and water to form a thick batter.3. Grease idly molds and pour the batter into them.4. Steam the idlies for 10-12 minutes.5. Serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Rice (2 cups), Urad Dal (1/2 cup), Pachi Pulusu (2 tbsp), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak 2 cups of rice and 1/2 cup of urad dal in water for 6-8 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked rice and dal separately into a fine batter.3. Mix the two batters together, add salt to taste, and mix well.4. Let the batter ferment in a warm place for 8-12 hours or overnight.5. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.6. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it into a thick circle.7. Add 2 tablespoons of pachi pulusu evenly over the dosa.8. Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges of the dosa.9. Cook until the dosa turns golden brown and the edges are crispy.10. Fold the dosa and serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (2 cups), Moong Dal (1/2 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak moong dal in water for 4-5 hours. Drain and grind into a coarse paste.2. Mix rice flour, ground moong dal, salt, and water to form a dough.3. Knead the dough until smooth and let it rest for 30 minutes.4. Divide the dough into small balls and shape them into discs.5. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.6. Drop the shaped discs into the hot oil and fry until golden brown and crispy.7. Serve hot with chutney or spicy curry.

Ingredients: Green Gram (1 cup), Cornmeal (1/2 cup), Rice (1/4 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak 1 cup of green gram and 1/4 cup of rice in water for 6-8 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked green gram and rice into a fine batter.3. Mix cornmeal, salt, and water to adjust consistency.4. Let the batter rest for 30 minutes.5. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.6. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it thinly.7. Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges of the dosa.8. Cook until the dosa turns golden brown and crispy.9. Fold the dosa and serve hot with ginger chutney or coconut chutney.

Ingredients: Ragi Flour (1 cup), Rice (1/2 cup), Onions (2, finely chopped), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak 1/2 cup of rice in water for 4-5 hours.2. Grind the soaked rice into a fine paste and mix it with 1 cup of ragi flour.3. Add water to make a smooth batter, add salt to taste, and mix well.4. Let the batter rest for 2-3 hours.5. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.6. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it into a thick circle.7. Sprinkle chopped onions evenly over the uttapam.8. Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges of the uttapam.9. Cook until the uttapam turns golden brown and crispy.10. Fold the uttapam and serve hot with chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Chana Dal (1 cup), Jackfruit Seeds (1/2 cup, boiled), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Coriander Leaves (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak chana dal in water for 4-5 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked dal into a coarse paste.3. Add boiled jackfruit seeds, chopped green chilies, curry leaves, coriander leaves, and salt. Mix well.4. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.5. Take a small portion of the mixture, shape it into a disc, and drop it into the hot oil.6. Fry until golden brown and crispy.7. Serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Green Chilies (6), Besan Flour (1 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Slit green chilies lengthwise without separating the halves.2. In a bowl, mix besan flour, water, salt, and red chili powder to form a thick batter.3. Dip each slit green chili into the batter, ensuring it is fully coated.4. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.5. Drop the coated chilies into the hot oil and fry until golden brown and crispy.6. Serve hot with coconut chutney or sauce.

Ingredients: Rava (1 cup), Eggplant (1, finely chopped), Water (2 cups), Oil (2 tbsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Green Chilies (2), Onion (1), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.3. Add chopped eggplant and cook for 5-7 minutes.4. Add water and salt, bring to a boil.5. Lower the heat and slowly add rava while stirring continuously.6. Cook until the rava is fully cooked and the water is absorbed.7. Serve hot with coconut chutney or pickle.

Ingredients: Wheat Flour (2 cups), Potatoes (2), Onion (1), Green Chilies (2), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix wheat flour, salt, and water to form a dough.2. Knead the dough until smooth and let it rest for 30 minutes.3. For the masala filling, boil potatoes until tender. Peel and mash them.4. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, chopped onions, and green chilies. Sauté until onions are translucent.5. Add turmeric powder, mashed potatoes, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.6. Divide the dough into small balls, flatten them, and stuff with the masala filling.7. Roll them into thin discs.8. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.9. Drop the rolled puris into the hot oil and fry until they puff up and turn golden brown.10. Serve hot with potato curry or pickle.

Ingredients: Wheat Flour (2 cups), Sesame Seeds (2 tbsp), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix wheat flour, roasted sesame seeds, salt, and water to form a dough.2. Knead the dough until smooth and let it rest for 30 minutes.3. Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into thin discs.4. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.5. Place the rolled roti on the pan and cook until golden brown spots appear.6. Drizzle oil or ghee on the roti and cook for another minute.7. Serve hot with pickle or curry.

Ingredients: Rava (1 cup), Eggs (2), Onion (1), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Coriander Leaves (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix rava, chopped onions, green chilies, curry leaves, coriander leaves, salt, and water to form a thick batter.2. Let the batter rest for 30 minutes.3. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.4. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it thinly.5. Crack an egg onto the center of the dosa and spread it gently over the surface.6. Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges of the dosa.7. Cook until the dosa turns golden brown and crispy.8. Fold the dosa and serve hot with chutney or sauce.

Ingredients: Wheat Flour (2 cups), Rava (1/2 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix wheat flour, rava, salt, and water to form a dough.2. Knead the dough until smooth and let it rest for 30 minutes.3. Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into thin discs.4. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.5. Drop the rolled puris into the hot oil and fry until they puff up and turn golden brown.6. Serve hot with potato curry or pickle.

Ingredients: Chana Dal (1 cup), Coriander Leaves (1/2 cup), Green Chilies (2), Ginger (1-inch piece), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak chana dal in water for 4-5 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked dal with coriander leaves, green chilies, and ginger into a coarse paste.3. Add salt to taste and mix well.4. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.5. Take a small portion of the mixture, shape it into a disc, and drop it into the hot oil.6. Fry until golden brown and crispy.7. Serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Wheat Flour (2 cups), Bengal Gram Flour (1/2 cup), Jaggery (1/2 cup), Mango Pulp (1/4 cup), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix wheat flour, bengal gram flour, jaggery, mango pulp, cardamom powder, salt, and water to form a dough.2. Knead the dough until smooth and let it rest for 30 minutes.3. Divide the dough into small balls and flatten them.4. Heat ghee in a pan and cook the flattened dough balls until golden brown on both sides.5. Serve hot as a sweet dish.

Ingredients: Green Gram (1 cup), Garlic (3 cloves), Rice (1/4 cup), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak 1 cup of green gram, 3 cloves of garlic, and 1/4 cup of rice in water for 6-8 hours.2. Drain the water and grind the soaked ingredients into a fine batter.3. Add salt to taste and mix well.4. Let the batter rest for 30 minutes.5. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.6. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it thinly.7. Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges of the dosa.8. Cook until the dosa turns golden brown and crispy.9. Fold the dosa and serve hot with ginger chutney or coconut chutney.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (2 cups), Jaggery (1/2 cup), Milk (1 cup), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix rice flour, melted jaggery, milk, cardamom powder, salt, and water to form a dough.2. Knead the dough until smooth and let it rest for 30 minutes.3. Divide the dough into small balls and flatten them.4. Heat ghee in a pan and cook the flattened dough balls until golden brown on both sides.5. Serve hot as a sweet dish.

Ingredients: Wheat Flour (2 cups), Kandi Podi (2 tbsp), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix wheat flour, kandi podi, salt, and water to form a smooth dough.2. Knead the dough until soft and pliable, then let it rest for 30 minutes.3. Divide the dough into small, equal-sized balls.4. Roll each ball into a thin disc using a rolling pin.5. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.6. Gently slide the rolled puris into the hot oil one at a time.7. Press lightly on the puri with a slotted spoon to help it puff up.8. Fry until the puris turn golden brown and crispy.9. Remove and drain excess oil on absorbent paper.10. Serve hot with potato curry, pickle, or chutney.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (1 cup), Sesame Seeds (2 tbsp), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)

Heat oil in a pan, spread the mixture evenly to form a thick pancake.4. Cook on low heat until crispy and golden brown on both sides.5. Serve hot with chutney or pickle.

Serve hot with chutney or pickle.

Ingredients: Jowar Flour (2 cups), Red Chili Powder (1 tsp), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix jowar flour, red chili powder, salt, and water to form a dough.2. Knead the dough until smooth and let it rest for 30 minutes.3. Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into thick discs.4. Heat a tawa or griddle over medium heat.5. Cook the rotis on the tawa, applying oil on both sides until golden brown.6. Serve hot with chutney or pickle.

Ingredients: Basmati Rice (1 cup), Curd (1 cup), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Cook basmati rice and let it cool.2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and cashews. Sauté until aromatic.3. Add turmeric powder and mix well.4. In a bowl, mix cooked rice, curd, and salt. Add the tempering and mix gently.5. Serve chilled with pickle or papad.

Ingredients: Basmati Rice (1 cup), Tamarind Paste (2 tbsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Peanuts (2 tbsp), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)

Mix well.4. Add cooked rice and mix gently to avoid breaking the rice.5. Cook for 2-3 minutes and serve hot with papad or pickle.

Ingredients: Basmati Rice (1 cup), Grated Coconut (1/2 cup), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)

Mix well.4. Add cooked rice and mix gently to avoid breaking the rice.5. Cook for 2-3 minutes and serve hot with raita or pickle.

Ingredients: Rava (1 cup), Curd (1 cup), Water (2 cups), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Green Chilies (2), Onion (1), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic.2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.3. Add water and salt, bring to a boil.4. Lower the heat and slowly add rava while stirring continuously.5. Once cooked, let it cool slightly and mix in curd.6. Serve chilled as a cooling breakfast.

Ingredients: Basmati Rice (1 cup), Sesame Seeds (2 tbsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Cook basmati rice and keep aside.2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and cashews. Sauté until aromatic.3. Add sesame seeds, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well.4. Add cooked rice and mix gently to avoid breaking the rice.5. Cook for 2-3 minutes and serve hot with pickle or papad.

Ingredients: Basmati Rice (1 cup), Raw Mango (1, grated), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Peanuts (2 tbsp), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Cook basmati rice and keep aside.2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and peanuts. Sauté until aromatic.3. Add grated raw mango, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook until soft.4. Add cooked rice and mix gently to avoid breaking the rice.5. Cook for 2-3 minutes and serve hot with raita or pickle.

Ingredients: Rice (1 cup), Tamarind Paste (2 tbsp), Green Chilies (2), Salt (to taste), Coriander Leaves (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Cook rice and keep aside.2. In a bowl, mix tamarind paste, chopped green chilies, salt, and coriander leaves.3. Serve the raw tamarind sauce alongside cooked rice.

Ingredients: Rice (1 cup), Moong Dal (1/2 cup), Ghee (2 tbsp), Pepper (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Wash and soak rice and moong dal for 30 minutes.2. Heat ghee in a pressure cooker, add cumin seeds, pepper, and cashews. Sauté until aromatic.3. Add drained rice and dal, sauté for 2-3 minutes.4. Add water and salt, pressure cook for 3-4 whistles.5. Open the lid once the pressure releases and mix well.6. Serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Cluster Beans (1 cup), Moong Dal (1/2 cup), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Pressure cook cluster beans and moong dal until soft.2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and curry leaves. Sauté until aromatic.3. Add turmeric powder, cooked beans, and dal. Mix well.4. Add salt and cook for 2-3 minutes.5. Serve hot with rice and ghee.

Ingredients: Horse Gram (1 cup), Garlic (2 cloves), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak horse gram overnight and pressure cook until soft.2. Blend cooked horse gram with garlic and cumin seeds to form a soup.3. Heat oil in a pan, temper with cumin seeds.4. Add the blended soup, salt, and cook for 5-7 minutes.5. Serve hot with rice and ghee.

Ingredients: Urad Dal (1 cup), Jaggery (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Rice Flour (1/2 cup), Water (as needed), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak urad dal in water for 4-5 hours.2. Drain and grind the soaked dal into a fine batter.3. Heat jaggery with a little water until melted, then mix with the batter.4. Add cardamom powder and mix well.5. Shape the mixture into small balls, coat with rice flour, and deep fry until golden brown.6. Serve hot as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (2 cups), Sugar (1/2 cup), Milk (1/2 cup), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix rice flour, sugar, milk, ghee, and cardamom powder to form a dough.2. Shape the dough into small discs or crescents.3. Deep fry the shapes until golden brown and crispy.4. Serve hot as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Urad Dal (1 cup), Jaggery (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Ghee (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Roast urad dal until golden brown and grind into a fine powder.2. Heat jaggery with a little water until melted, then mix with the dal powder.3. Add cardamom powder and ghee, mix well.4. Shape the mixture into small laddus.5. Serve as a quick breakfast or snack.

Ingredients: Ingredients
Recipe Steps: Recipe Steps

Ingredients: Rice Flour (2 cups), Sugar (1 cup), Ghee (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Water (as needed)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix rice flour, sugar, cardamom powder, and water to form a thin batter. 2. Heat a flat griddle or pan over low heat. 3. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it thinly using a circular motion. 4. Drizzle ghee evenly over the surface. 5. Once cooked, carefully roll the thin layer into a cylindrical shape. 6. Repeat the process for the remaining batter. 7. Serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (2 cups), Jaggery (1 cup), Sesame Seeds (2 tbsp), Water (as needed), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat jaggery with a little water until melted and forms a thick syrup. 2. Add rice flour gradually to the syrup and mix well to form a dough. 3. Let the dough rest for 10-15 minutes. 4. Shape the dough into small discs and coat them with sesame seeds. 5. Deep fry the discs in hot oil until golden brown. 6. Drain on absorbent paper and serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Chana Dal (1 cup), Jaggery (1/2 cup), Wheat Flour (2 cups), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Ghee (2 tbsp), Water (as needed)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak chana dal overnight and cook until soft. 2. Mash the cooked dal and mix with jaggery and cardamom powder. Cook until dry. 3. Knead wheat flour with water to form a soft dough. 4. Divide the dough and filling into equal portions. 5. Flatten a dough ball, place the filling in the center, and seal the edges. 6. Roll into a flat disc and cook on a hot tawa with ghee until golden brown. 7. Serve hot with ghee.

Ingredients: Maida (2 cups), Sugar (1 cup), Ghee (1/2 cup), Curd (2 tbsp), Baking Soda (1/4 tsp), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix maida, curd, baking soda, and ghee to form a dough. 2. Rest the dough for 30 minutes. 3. Divide the dough into small portions and roll them into thin strips. 4. Twist the strips into spiral shapes. 5. Deep fry the spirals in hot oil until golden brown. 6. Soak the fried kajas in sugar syrup and serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Maida (2 cups), Sugar (1 cup), Ghee (1/2 cup), Curd (2 tbsp), Baking Soda (1/4 tsp), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix maida, curd, baking soda, and ghee to form a dough. 2. Rest the dough for 30 minutes. 3. Divide the dough into small portions and roll them into thin strips. 4. Twist the strips into spiral shapes. 5. Deep fry the spirals in hot oil until golden brown. 6. Soak the fried kajas in sugar syrup and serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (2 cups), Sugar (1/2 cup), Milk (1/2 cup), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix rice flour, sugar, milk, ghee, and cardamom powder to form a dough. 2. Shape the dough into small discs or crescents. 3. Deep fry the shapes until golden brown and crispy. 4. Serve hot as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Rice (1 cup), Moong Dal (1/2 cup), Jaggery (1/2 cup), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Wash and soak rice and moong dal for 30 minutes. 2. Pressure cook the soaked rice and dal until soft. 3. Heat jaggery with a little water until melted, then mix with the cooked rice and dal. 4. Add ghee, cardamom powder, and roasted cashews. 5. Cook for 5-7 minutes and serve hot as a sweet dish.

Dish Name: Payasam (Bellam, Pal Payasam, Semiya Payasam, Gasagasala Payasam)
Ingredients: Vermicelli (1 cup), Milk (2 cups), Sugar (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Raisins (2 tbsp), Ghee (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Roast vermicelli in ghee until golden brown. 2. Boil milk in a separate pan and add the roasted vermicelli. 3. Cook until the vermicelli is soft. 4. Add sugar, cardamom powder, and mix well. 5. Garnish with roasted cashews and raisins. 6. Serve hot or chilled.

Ingredients: Besan (2 cups), Sugar (1 cup), Water (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Ghee (2 tbsp), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix besan with water to form a smooth batter. 2. Heat oil in a pan and use a perforated ladle to drop small droplets of batter into the oil. 3. Fry until golden brown and drain on absorbent paper. 4. Prepare sugar syrup by boiling sugar and water. 5. Mix the fried boondi with the sugar syrup and shape into laddus. 6. Let it cool and serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Besan (2 cups), Sugar (1 cup), Ghee (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Raisins (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Roast besan in ghee until golden brown and aromatic. 2. Add sugar, cardamom powder, cashews, and raisins. Mix well. 3. Shape the mixture into small laddus while still warm. 4. Let it cool and serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Urad Dal (1 cup), Jaggery (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Ghee (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Roast urad dal until golden brown and grind into a fine powder. 2. Heat jaggery with a little water until melted, then mix with the dal powder. 3. Add cardamom powder and ghee, mix well. 4. Shape the mixture into small laddus. 5. Serve as a quick breakfast or snack.

Ingredients: Rava (2 cups), Sugar (1 cup), Ghee (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Raisins (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Roast rava in ghee until golden brown. 2. Add sugar, cardamom powder, cashews, and raisins. Mix well. 3. Shape the mixture into small laddus while still warm. 4. Let it cool and serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Milk Powder (2 cups), Sugar (1 cup), Ghee (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Raisins (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix milk powder, sugar, and ghee in a pan. 2. Cook on low heat until the mixture comes together. 3. Add cardamom powder, cashews, and raisins. Mix well. 4. Shape the mixture into small laddus while still warm. 5. Let it cool and serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Maida (2 cups), Kova (1 cup), Sugar (1/2 cup), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix maida and ghee to form a dough. Rest for 30 minutes. 2. Mix kova, sugar, and cardamom powder to form the filling. 3. Roll out the dough, place the filling, and seal the edges. 4. Deep fry the kajjikayalu in hot oil until golden brown. 5. Serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Maida (2 cups), Sugar (1 cup), Ghee (1/2 cup), Curd (2 tbsp), Baking Soda (1/4 tsp), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix maida, curd, baking soda, and ghee to form a dough. 2. Rest the dough for 30 minutes. 3. Divide the dough into small portions and roll them into thin strips. 4. Twist the strips into spiral shapes. 5. Deep fry the spirals in hot oil until golden brown. 6. Soak the fried kajas in sugar syrup and serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Coconut (1 cup, grated), Sugar (1/2 cup), Rice Flour (2 tbsp), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Ghee (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix grated coconut, sugar, rice flour, and cardamom powder. 2. Cook on low heat until the mixture comes together. 3. Shape the mixture into small balls. 4. Serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Jaggery (1 cup), Rice Flour (2 tbsp), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Ghee (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat jaggery with a little water until melted. 2. Add rice flour, cardamom powder, and ghee. Mix well. 3. Cook until the mixture thickens. 4. Shape the mixture into small balls. 5. Serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Raw Banana (2), Rice Flour (1/2 cup), Salt (to taste), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Peel and grate raw bananas. 2. Mix grated bananas with rice flour and salt to form a dough. 3. Shape the dough into small cylinders. 4. Deep fry the cylinders in hot oil until golden brown. 5. Serve as a savory snack.

Ingredients: Rava (1 cup), Sugar (1/2 cup), Water (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Raisins (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Roast rava in ghee until golden brown. 2. Boil water and sugar to prepare a syrup. 3. Add the roasted rava to the syrup and mix well. 4. Add cardamom powder, cashews, and raisins. Mix well. 5. Serve as a sweet dish.

Ingredients: Sabudana (1 cup), Milk (1 cup), Sugar (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Raisins (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak sabudana in water for 30 minutes. 2. Heat ghee in a pan, add cashews and raisins. Sauté until golden brown. 3. Add soaked sabudana and sauté for 2-3 minutes. 4. Add milk, sugar, and cardamom powder. Cook until thick. 5. Serve as a sweet dish.

Ingredients: Carrots (2 cups, grated), Milk (1 cup), Sugar (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Raisins (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Grate carrots and cook them with milk until soft. 2. Add sugar, cardamom powder, and ghee. Mix well. 3. Cook until the mixture thickens. 4. Garnish with roasted cashews and raisins. 5. Serve as a sweet dish.

Ingredients: Almonds (1 cup), Milk (1 cup), Sugar (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Raisins (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak almonds in water for 30 minutes, peel, and grind into a paste. 2. Heat ghee in a pan, add almond paste and sauté for 2-3 minutes. 3. Add milk, sugar, and cardamom powder. Cook until thick. 4. Garnish with roasted cashews and raisins. 5. Serve as a sweet dish.

Ingredients: Maida (2 cups), Sugar (1 cup), Ghee (1/2 cup), Curd (2 tbsp), Baking Soda (1/4 tsp), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix maida, curd, baking soda, and ghee to form a dough. 2. Rest the dough for 30 minutes. 3. Divide the dough into small portions and roll them into thin strips. 4. Twist the strips into spiral shapes. 5. Deep fry the spirals in hot oil until golden brown. 6. Soak the fried kajas in sugar syrup and serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (2 cups), Jaggery (1/2 cup), Sesame Seeds (2 tbsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat jaggery with a little water until melted. 2. Mix rice flour, sesame seeds, and cumin seeds with the jaggery syrup to form a dough. 3. Shape the dough into small rings. 4. Deep fry the rings in hot oil until golden brown. 5. Serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Sesame Seeds (1 cup), Jaggery (1/2 cup), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Roast sesame seeds until golden brown. 2. Heat jaggery with a little water until melted. 3. Mix roasted sesame seeds, jaggery syrup, ghee, and cardamom powder. 4. Shape the mixture into small laddus. 5. Serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (1 cup), Urad Dal (1/2 cup), Jaggery (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Ghee (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Roast rice flour and urad dal separately until golden brown. 2. Heat jaggery with a little water until melted. 3. Mix roasted rice flour, urad dal, jaggery syrup, ghee, and cardamom powder. 4. Shape the mixture into small laddus. 5. Serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Besan (2 cups), Sugar (1 cup), Water (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Raisins (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix besan with water to form a smooth batter. 2. Heat oil in a pan and use a perforated ladle to drop small droplets of batter into the oil. 3. Fry until golden brown and drain on absorbent paper. 4. Prepare sugar syrup by boiling sugar and water. 5. Mix the fried boondi with the sugar syrup and cook until thick. 6. Garnish with roasted cashews and raisins. 7. Serve as a sweet dish.

Ingredients: Dates (1 cup), Nuts (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Ghee (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Blend dates and nuts into a smooth paste. 2. Heat ghee in a pan, add the date-nut paste and cardamom powder. 3. Cook until the mixture thickens. 4. Shape the mixture into small laddus. 5. Serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Dates (1 cup), Milk (2 cups), Sugar (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Raisins (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak dates in water for 30 minutes, remove seeds, and blend into a paste. 2. Boil milk in a pan, add the date paste, and mix well. 3. Add sugar, cardamom powder, cashews, and raisins. Cook until thick. 4. Serve as a sweet dish.

Ingredients: Almonds (1 cup), Milk (2 cups), Sugar (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Raisins (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak almonds in water for 30 minutes, peel, and grind into a paste. 2. Boil milk in a pan, add the almond paste, and mix well. 3. Add sugar, cardamom powder, cashews, and raisins. Cook until thick. 4. Serve as a sweet dish.

Ingredients: Maida (2 cups), Kova (1 cup), Sugar (1/2 cup), Ghee (2 tbsp), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix maida and ghee to form a dough. Rest for 30 minutes. 2. Mix kova and sugar to form the filling. 3. Roll out the dough, place the filling, and seal the edges. 4. Deep fry the puris in hot oil until golden brown. 5. Serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Cottage Cheese (2 cups), Sugar (1 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Ghee (2 tbsp), Raisins (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix cottage cheese, sugar, cardamom powder, ghee, and raisins. 2. Grease a baking tray and spread the mixture evenly. 3. Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C for 30-35 minutes until golden brown. 4. Let it cool and cut into pieces. 5. Serve as a sweet dish.

Ingredients: Besan (2 cups), Sugar (1 cup), Ghee (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Raisins (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Roast besan in ghee until golden brown and aromatic. 2. Add sugar, cardamom powder, cashews, and raisins. Mix well. 3. Shape the mixture into small laddus while still warm. 4. Let it cool and serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Besan (2 cups), Sugar (1 cup), Water (1/2 cup), Saffron (a pinch), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix besan with water to form a smooth batter. 2. Heat oil in a pan and use a perforated ladle to drop small droplets of batter into the oil. 3. Fry until golden brown and drain on absorbent paper. 4. Prepare sugar syrup by boiling sugar and water. Add saffron. 5. Soak the fried jangri in sugar syrup and serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Besan (2 cups), Sugar (1 cup), Ghee (1 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat ghee in a pan, add besan, and roast until golden brown. 2. Add sugar and cardamom powder. Mix well. 3. Cook until the mixture thickens and leaves the sides of the pan. 4. Spread the mixture on a greased tray and let it cool. 5. Cut into pieces and serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (2 cups), Jaggery (1 cup), Sesame Seeds (2 tbsp), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Ghee (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat jaggery with a little water until melted. 2. Mix rice flour, sesame seeds, and cardamom powder with the jaggery syrup to form a dough. 3. Shape the dough into small balls. 4. Serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (2 cups), Milk (1 cup), Sugar (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Ghee (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix rice flour with water to form a dough. 2. Roll the dough into thin strings. 3. Boil milk, add sugar, and cardamom powder. 4. Add the rice strings to the milk and cook until soft. 5. Garnish with ghee and serve as a sweet dish.

Ingredients: Maida (2 cups), Coconut (1 cup, grated), Sugar (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Ghee (2 tbsp), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix maida and ghee to form a dough. Rest for 30 minutes. 2. Mix grated coconut, sugar, and cardamom powder to form the filling. 3. Roll out the dough, place the filling, and seal the edges. 4. Deep fry the kajjikayalu in hot oil until golden brown. 5. Serve as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Wheat Flour (2 cups), Jaggery (1/2 cup), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix wheat flour, jaggery, ghee, and cardamom powder to form a dough. 2. Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into thin discs. 3. Heat a tawa or griddle over medium heat. 4. Cook the rotis on the tawa, applying ghee on both sides until golden brown. 5. Serve hot as a sweet dish.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (2 cups), Milk (1 cup), Sugar (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Ghee (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix rice flour with water to form a dough. 2. Roll the dough into thin strings. 3. Boil milk, add sugar, and cardamom powder. 4. Add the rice strings to the milk and cook until soft. 5. Garnish with ghee and serve as a sweet dish.

Ingredients: Ingredients
Recipe Steps: Recipe Steps

Ingredients: Potatoes (2), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Peel and chop potatoes into cubes. Boil until soft but firm. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add turmeric powder and boiled potatoes. Mix well and cook for 5-7 minutes on medium heat. 4. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Raw Bananas (2), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Peel and slice raw bananas into thin pieces. Soak in water to prevent browning. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add turmeric powder and banana slices. Cook until golden brown and crispy. 4. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Brinjal (2), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Chop brinjal into small pieces. Soak in salted water for 10 minutes. Drain and pat dry. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add turmeric powder and brinjal pieces. Cook until soft and golden brown. 4. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Okra (200g), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Wash and chop okra into small pieces. Dry roast in a pan until slightly crispy. Set aside. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add turmeric powder and roasted okra. Mix well and cook for 5-7 minutes. 4. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Yellow Cucumber (1), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Peel and chop yellow cucumber into small pieces. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add turmeric powder and cucumber pieces. Cook until soft and golden brown. 4. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Cluster Beans (200g), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Wash and chop cluster beans into small pieces. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add turmeric powder and cluster beans. Cook until soft and golden brown. 4. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Broad Beans (200g), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Wash and chop broad beans into small pieces. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add turmeric powder and broad beans. Cook until soft and golden brown. 4. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Bitter Gourd (2), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Wash and slice bitter gourd thinly. Soak in salted water for 10 minutes. Drain and pat dry. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add turmeric powder and bitter gourd slices. Cook until soft and golden brown. 4. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Ridge Gourd (1), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Peel and chop ridge gourd into small pieces. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add turmeric powder and ridge gourd pieces. Cook until soft and golden brown. 4. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Drumsticks (2), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Wash and chop drumsticks into small pieces. Boil until soft but firm. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add turmeric powder and boiled drumstick pieces. Mix well and cook for 5-7 minutes. 4. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Yam (200g), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Peel and chop yam into small cubes. Boil until soft but firm. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add turmeric powder and boiled yam cubes. Mix well and cook for 5-7 minutes. 4. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Ivy Gourd (200g), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Wash and slice ivy gourd thinly. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add turmeric powder and ivy gourd slices. Cook until soft and golden brown. 4. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Cabbage (1 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Shred cabbage finely. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add turmeric powder and shredded cabbage. Cook until soft and golden brown. 4. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Carrots (1), Beans (100g), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Chop carrots and beans into small pieces. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add turmeric powder, carrots, and beans. Cook until soft and golden brown. 4. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Fenugreek Leaves (1 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Wash and chop fenugreek leaves finely. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add turmeric powder and fenugreek leaves. Cook until soft and fragrant. 4. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Coriander Leaves (1 cup), Green Chilies (2), Coconut (1/2 cup, grated), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Wash and chop coriander leaves finely. 2. Blend coriander leaves, green chilies, grated coconut, cumin seeds, and salt with water to form a paste. 3. Heat oil in a pan, temper with cumin seeds. Pour over the chutney. 4. Serve chilled as a side dish.

Add fried paneer cubes and cream. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes. 6. Serve hot with naan or roti.

Add chopped onion and tomato. Cook until soft. 4. Add cooked bengal gram, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well and simmer for 5-7 minutes. 5. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Recipe Steps: 1. Boil green peas until soft but firm. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add chopped onion and tomato. Cook until soft. 4. Add boiled green peas, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well and simmer for 5-7 minutes. 5. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Potatoes (2), Fenugreek Leaves (1 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Peel and chop potatoes into small cubes. Boil until soft but firm. 2. Wash and chop fenugreek leaves finely. 3. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 4. Add boiled potatoes, fenugreek leaves, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well and simmer for 5-7 minutes. 5. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Dish Name: Kanda Bachali Koora (Yam and Malabar Spinach Curry)
Ingredients: Yam (1 cup), Malabar Spinach (1 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Peel and chop yam into small cubes. Boil until soft but firm. 2. Wash and chop malabar spinach finely. 3. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 4. Add boiled yam, malabar spinach, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well and simmer for 5-7 minutes. 5. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Tomatoes (2), Peanuts (1/2 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Roast peanuts and grind into a coarse powder. 2. Chop tomatoes into small pieces and boil until soft. 3. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 4. Add boiled tomatoes, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well. 5. Add ground peanut powder and simmer for 5-7 minutes. 6. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Dish Name: Methi Malai Mutter (Fenugreek & Green Peas Curry)
Ingredients: Green Peas (1 cup), Fenugreek Leaves (1 cup), Cream (2 tbsp), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Boil green peas until soft but firm. 2. Wash and chop fenugreek leaves finely. 3. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 4. Add boiled green peas, fenugreek leaves, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well. 5. Add cream and simmer for 5-7 minutes. 6. Serve hot with naan or roti.

Dish Name: Thotakura Tomato Koora (Amaranth Leaves Tomato Curry)
Ingredients: Amaranth Leaves (1 cup), Tomatoes (2), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Wash and chop amaranth leaves finely. 2. Chop tomatoes into small pieces and boil until soft. 3. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 4. Add boiled tomatoes, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well. 5. Add amaranth leaves and simmer for 5-7 minutes. 6. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Black-Eyed Peas (1 cup), Onion (1), Tomato (1), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak black-eyed peas overnight and pressure cook until soft. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add chopped onion and tomato. Cook until soft. 4. Add cooked black-eyed peas, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well and simmer for 5-7 minutes. 5. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Capsicum (1), Tomatoes (2), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Chop capsicum and tomatoes into small pieces. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add chopped capsicum and tomatoes. Cook until soft. 4. Add turmeric powder and salt. Mix well and simmer for 5-7 minutes. 5. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Dish Name: Beerakaya Senagapappu Koora (Ridge Gourd Bengal Gram Curry)
Ingredients: Ridge Gourd (1), Bengal Gram (1 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak bengal gram overnight and pressure cook until soft. 2. Peel and chop ridge gourd into small pieces. Boil until soft but firm. 3. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 4. Add boiled ridge gourd, cooked bengal gram, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well and simmer for 5-7 minutes. 5. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Dish Name: Kakarakaya Kobbari Koora (Bitter Gourd Coconut Curry)
Ingredients: Bitter Gourd (1), Grated Coconut (1/2 cup), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Wash and slice bitter gourd thinly. Boil until soft but firm. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add boiled bitter gourd, grated coconut, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well and simmer for 5-7 minutes. 4. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (1 cup), Sesame Seeds (2 tbsp), Green Chilies (2), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix rice flour, salt, chopped green chilies, curry leaves, and sesame seeds in a bowl. 2. Add water gradually to form a dough-like consistency. 3. Heat oil in a pan, spread the mixture evenly to form a thick pancake. 4. Cook on low heat until crispy and golden brown on both sides. 5. Serve hot with chutney or pickle.

Ingredients: Pearl Millet Flour (2 cups), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix pearl millet flour, salt, and water to form a dough. 2. Knead the dough until smooth and let it rest for 30 minutes. 3. Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into thick discs. 4. Heat a tawa or griddle over medium heat. 5. Cook the rotis on the tawa, applying oil on both sides until golden brown. 6. Serve hot with chutney or pickle.

Ingredients: Ragi Flour (2 cups), Water (as needed), Salt (to taste), Oil (for cooking)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix ragi flour, salt, and water to form a dough. 2. Knead the dough until smooth and let it rest for 30 minutes. 3. Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into thick discs. 4. Heat a tawa or griddle over medium heat. 5. Cook the rotis on the tawa, applying oil on both sides until golden brown. 6. Serve hot with chutney or pickle.

Recipe Steps: 1. Mix green gram flour, salt, and water to form a dough. 2. Knead the dough until smooth and let it rest for 30 minutes. 3. Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into thin discs. 4. Heat a tawa or griddle over medium heat. 5. Cook the rotis on the tawa, applying oil on both sides until golden brown. 6. Serve hot with chutney or pickle.

Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into thick discs. 4. Heat a tawa or griddle over medium heat. 5. Cook the rotis on the tawa, applying oil on both sides until golden brown. 6. Recipe Steps: 1. Mix jowar flour, red chili powder, salt, and water to form a dough. 2. Knead the dough until smooth and let it rest for 30 minutes. 3. Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into thick discs. 4. Heat a tawa or griddle over medium heat. 5. Cook the rotis on the tawa, applying oil on both sides until golden brown. 6. Serve hot with chutney or pickle.

Ingredients: Basmati Rice (1 cup), Curd (1 cup), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Cook basmati rice and let it cool. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and cashews. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add turmeric powder and mix well. 4. In a bowl, mix cooked rice, curd, and salt. Add the tempering and mix gently. 5. Serve chilled with pickle or papad.

Ingredients: Basmati Rice (1 cup), Tamarind Paste (2 tbsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Peanuts (2 tbsp), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Cook basmati rice and keep aside. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and peanuts. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add tamarind paste, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well. 4. Add cooked rice and mix gently to avoid breaking the rice. 5. Cook for 2-3 minutes and serve hot with papad or pickle.

Ingredients: Basmati Rice (1 cup), Grated Coconut (1/2 cup), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Cook basmati rice and keep aside. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and cashews. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add grated coconut, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well. 4. Add cooked rice and mix gently to avoid breaking the rice. 5. Cook for 2-3 minutes and serve hot with raita or pickle.

Ingredients: Rava (1 cup), Curd (1 cup), Water (2 cups), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Green Chilies (2), Onion (1), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until aromatic. 2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 3. Add water and salt, bring to a boil. 4. Lower the heat and slowly add rava while stirring continuously. 5. Once cooked, let it cool slightly and mix in curd. 6. Serve chilled as a cooling breakfast.

Ingredients: Basmati Rice (1 cup), Sesame Seeds (2 tbsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Cook basmati rice and keep aside. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and cashews. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add sesame seeds, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well. 4. Add cooked rice and mix gently to avoid breaking the rice. 5. Cook for 2-3 minutes and serve hot with pickle or papad.

Ingredients: Basmati Rice (1 cup), Raw Mango (1, grated), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Peanuts (2 tbsp), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Cook basmati rice and keep aside. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and peanuts. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add grated raw mango, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook until soft. 4. Add cooked rice and mix gently to avoid breaking the rice. 5. Cook for 2-3 minutes and serve hot with raita or pickle.

Ingredients: Rice (1 cup), Tamarind Paste (2 tbsp), Green Chilies (2), Salt (to taste), Coriander Leaves (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Cook rice and keep aside. 2. In a bowl, mix tamarind paste, chopped green chilies, salt, and coriander leaves. 3. Serve the raw tamarind sauce alongside cooked rice.

Ingredients: Rice (1 cup), Moong Dal (1/2 cup), Ghee (2 tbsp), Pepper (1 tsp), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Cashews (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste)
Recipe Steps: 1. Wash and soak rice and moong dal for 30 minutes. 2. Heat ghee in a pressure cooker, add cumin seeds, pepper, and cashews. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add drained rice and dal, sauté for 2-3 minutes. 4. Add water and salt, pressure cook for 3-4 whistles. 5. Open the lid once the pressure releases and mix well. 6. Serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Cluster Beans (1 cup), Moong Dal (1/2 cup), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp), Mustard Seeds (1 tsp), Curry Leaves (10), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Pressure cook cluster beans and moong dal until soft. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and curry leaves. Sauté until aromatic. 3. Add turmeric powder, cooked beans, and dal. Mix well. 4. Add salt and cook for 2-3 minutes. 5. Serve hot with rice and ghee.

Ingredients: Horse Gram (1 cup), Garlic (2 cloves), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Salt (to taste), Oil (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak horse gram overnight and pressure cook until soft. 2. Blend cooked horse gram with garlic and cumin seeds to form a soup. 3. Heat oil in a pan, temper with cumin seeds. 4. Add the blended soup, salt, and cook for 5-7 minutes. 5. Serve hot with rice and ghee.

Ingredients: Urad Dal (1 cup), Jaggery (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Rice Flour (1/2 cup), Water (as needed), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Soak urad dal in water for 4-5 hours. 2. Drain and grind the soaked dal into a fine batter. 3. Heat jaggery with a little water until melted, then mix with the batter. 4. Add cardamom powder and mix well. 5. Shape the mixture into small balls, coat with rice flour, and deep fry until golden brown. 6. Serve hot as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Rice Flour (2 cups), Sugar (1/2 cup), Milk (1/2 cup), Ghee (2 tbsp), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Oil (for deep frying)
Recipe Steps: 1. Mix rice flour, sugar, milk, ghee, and cardamom powder to form a dough. 2. Shape the dough into small discs or crescents. 3. Deep fry the shapes until golden brown and crispy. 4. Serve hot as a sweet snack.

Ingredients: Urad Dal (1 cup), Jaggery (1/2 cup), Cardamom Powder (1/2 tsp), Ghee (2 tbsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Roast urad dal until golden brown and grind into a fine powder. 2. Heat jaggery with a little water until melted, then mix with the dal powder. 3. Add cardamom powder and ghee, mix well. 4. Shape the mixture into small laddus. 5. Serve as a quick breakfast or snack.

Ingredients: Potato (1, chopped), Curd (1/2 cup), Onion (1), Tomato (2), Green Chilies (2), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add chopped onions, green chilies, and sauté until golden brown.2. Add chopped tomatoes and potato. Cook until soft.3. Add curd, salt, and turmeric powder. Mix well.4. Cook for 10-15 minutes on low heat.5. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Drumstick Leaves (1 cup), Toor Dal (1/2 cup), Tomato (2), Onion (1), Green Chilies (2), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Pressure cook toor dal until soft. Set aside.2. Heat oil in a pan, add chopped onions, green chilies, and sauté until golden brown.3. Add chopped tomatoes and drumstick leaves. Cook until soft.4. Add cooked toor dal, salt, and turmeric powder. Mix well.5. Cook for 10-15 minutes on low heat.6. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Carrot (1 cup, chopped), Snake Gourd (1 cup, chopped), Onion (1), Tomato (2), Green Chilies (2), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp)

Ingredients: Drumstick (1, chopped), Cumin Seeds (1 tsp), Onion (1), Tomato (2), Green Chilies (2), Oil (2 tbsp), Salt (to taste), Turmeric Powder (1/2 tsp)
Recipe Steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, chopped onions, green chilies, and sauté until golden brown.2. Add chopped tomatoes and drumstick pieces. Cook until soft.3. Add salt and turmeric powder. Mix well.4. Cook for 10-15 minutes on low heat.5. Serve hot with rice or roti.
